name: Amazon Rekognition

pricing_table.feature: Image Analysis (Labels, Faces, Content Moderation, Text) - Tier 1 (0 - 1M images)
Image Analysis (Labels, Faces, Content Moderation, Text) - Tier 2 (1M - 10M images)
Image Analysis (Labels, Faces, Content Moderation, Text) - Tier 3 (10M - 100M images)
Image Analysis (Labels, Faces, Content Moderation, Text) - Tier 4 (Over 100M images)
Face Comparison and Search - Tier 1 (0 - 1M images)

pricing_table.price: $0.00001 per 1,000 Face Metadata vectors stored per month

pricing.overall_notes: Prices verified against US East (N. Virginia) region on 2025-03-31. Free tier includes processing 5,000 images per month and storing 1,000 face metadata vectors for the first 12 months. Pricing varies significantly by specific feature (e.g., PPE detection, Celebrity Recognition have different rates). Check official pricing page. Pricing source: https://aws.amazon.com/rekognition/pricing/

pros: Easy integration with other AWS services
No upfront costs or minimum fees
cons: Limited customization compared to some competitors

user_reviews.summary: Amazon Rekognition generally earns positive feedback for its powerful and accurate computer vision capabilities. Users frequently praise its ease of integration within the AWS ecosystem and its effectiveness in tasks like facial recognition and content moderation. G2 reviewers (4.3/5 stars, 28 reviews) specifically commend the quality of support and documentation. Capterra users (4.5/5 stars, 2 reviews) highlight its strong performance in object detection, including timestamping in videos. However, a recurring concern revolves around cost, with some users finding the pricing complex and potentially expensive for high-volume applications. While customization is possible, some reviewers feel it's less flexible than certain alternatives.

sources.name: Capterra
highlights: Best objects detection with proper timestamps in video

common_uses_from_reviews: Automated Content Moderation: Reviewers often use Rekognition to automatically flag inappropriate or harmful content in user-generated images and videos, reducing manual review workload.
Enhanced Video Analysis: Users leverage the service to analyze video streams, detecting specific activities, tracking people's movement, and identifying objects or celebrities.
Face Matching & Verification: A common application mentioned is using Rekognition's facial analysis for identity verification or searching for specific individuals within large image collections.

scalability: Designed for high scalability, leveraging AWS infrastructure

use_cases.title: Content Moderation
use_cases.description: Automatically detect inappropriate content in images/videos
use_cases.example: Filter user-uploaded content for social platforms

use_cases.title: Retail Analytics
use_cases.description: Analyze shelf inventory and product placement

use_cases.title: Security Applications
use_cases.description: Facial recognition for authentication and surveillance

description: Amazon Rekognition offers deep learning-based image and video analysis. It can identify objects, people, text, scenes, and activities in media, as well as detect inappropriate content. As part of AWS's AI services, it provides accurate computer vision capabilities without requiring machine learning expertise.
